title: How to Open an EMZ File on PC or Mac

steps.title: Open an MS Office program like Word or PowerPoint.
steps.content: Open an MS Office program like Word or PowerPoint. You can find this in either your Start Menu or Finder .

steps.title: Open a blank/new document.
steps.content: Open a blank/new document.

steps.title: Click Insert.
steps.content: Click Insert . A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Image.
steps.content: Click Image . Your file browser will load.

steps.title: Navigate to your EMZ file.
steps.content: Navigate to your EMZ file.

steps.title: Double-click to open the file.
steps.content: Double-click to open the file. The EMZ file will be added into the document as an image. You cannot edit it.

steps.title: Navigate to https://www.7-zip.org/.
steps.content: Navigate to https://www.7-zip.org/ .

steps.title: Click to download either the 32-bit X84 or 64-bit x64 file.
steps.content: Click to download either the 32-bit X84 or 64-bit x64 file. A pop-up box will appear for the download location.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . The installer will save in the location you picked in the previous step, which is most likely the Downloads folder.

steps.title: Click the 7-Zip Installer to launch it.
steps.content: Click the 7-Zip Installer to launch it. Click Allow changes if prompted.

steps.title: Click Install.
steps.content: Click Install . You will see a progress bar as the installation progresses.

steps.title: Click Close.
steps.content: Click Close .

steps.title: Open 7-Zip File Manager.
steps.content: Open 7-Zip File Manager. You can find this in your Start Menu.

steps.title: Navigate to the EMZ file.
steps.content: Navigate to the EMZ file. This program works just like the native file manager on your computer.

steps.title: Click your EMZ file.
steps.content: Click your EMZ file. It will highlight in blue.

steps.title: Click the extract button.
steps.content: Click the extract button. This is at the top of the window and looks like a blue minus button. A window will pop up with options such as extraction location.

steps.title: Click Ok.
steps.content: Click Ok . The files inside the EMZ file will extract into the location you specified in the previous step. The files contained in the EMZ file are now convertible to a PNG file format. You can do this by repeating steps 8-11, but selecting convert instead of extract.

steps.title: Go to XnView MP 0.93.1 in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to XnView MP 0.93.1 in a web browser. Click Download & Purchase if you are not already at that area of the website. You will see a link to purchase a license (if you're a company intending to use this software) and a link to donate via PayPal. Below that are options to download XnView for both Mac and Windows.

steps.title: Click the link for the installer you need, Mac or Windows.
steps.content: Click the link for the installer you need, Mac or Windows. Your file browser will pop up for the download location and file name.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . The installer file will save in the location you picked in the previous step, which is most likely the Downloads folder.

steps.title: Click the XnViewMP Installer to launch it.
steps.content: Click the XnViewMP Installer to launch it.

steps.title: Follow the Installer Setup Wizard.
steps.content: Follow the Installer Setup Wizard. It will lead you through setting up and installing XnView. Read any and all agreements before clicking I agree .

steps.title: Click Install.
steps.content: Click Install . You will see a progress bar as the installation progresses.

steps.title: Open XNViewMP.
steps.content: Open XNViewMP. You can find this in either the Start Menu or in Finder . The program will open in Browse Mode.

steps.title: Click File.
steps.content: Click File . This is in the top ribbon and a menu will drop down.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open . Your file browser will open.

steps.title: Navigate to your EMZ file.
steps.content: Navigate to your EMZ file.

steps.title: Double-click on your EMZ file to open it.
steps.content: Double-click on your EMZ file to open it. You can view your file, but not edit it.

steps.title: Click Tools.
steps.content: Click Tools . This is in the top ribbon and a menu will drop down.

steps.title: Click Batch Convert.
steps.content: Click Batch Convert . The Batch Convert menu will open to the Output tab. You can add files to the conversion by clicking the Input tab and pressing Add .

steps.title: Change the file format from the drop-down list.
steps.content: Change the file format from the drop-down list. This is on the right-hand side under the header Format. You can alter any settings here.

steps.title: Click Convert.
steps.content: Click Convert . Your files will save in the converted format in the location selected. This defaults to the same location your files originally came from.
